CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ).

Let's think step by step.

1. 1 : 4 w / w blend
2. photoactive layer
3. PCDTBT : PC71BM

These are the "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph. They are materials or substances that are either being used in the described device or being compared to it.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. 1 : 4 w / w blend
2. photoactive layer
3. PCDTBT : PC71BM

I have removed any entities that are not clearly related to materials or substances, and the resulting list includes only the "Material Name" entities.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| 1 : 4 w / w blend |
| photoactive layer |
| PCDTBT : PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ).

Let's think step by step.

1. J SC: It is a property name which stands for Short-Circuit Current Density.
2. V OC: It is a property name which stands for Open-Circuit Voltage.
3. FF: It is a property name which stands for Fill Factor.
4. PCE: It is a property name which stands for Power Conversion Efficiency.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. J SC: Short-Circuit Current Density
2. V OC: Open-Circuit Voltage
3. FF: Fill Factor
4. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| J SC |
| V OC |
| FF |
| PCE |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ).

Let's think step by step.

1. J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2
2. V OC of 0.79 V
3. FF of 45%
4. PCE of 4.12%

These are the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph. They refer to specific properties and their corresponding values of a device or system being discussed. In this case, they are related to the performance of a solar cell.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2
2. V OC of 0.79 V
3. FF of 45%
4. PCE of 4.12%

These are the relevant "Value of Material Property" entities in the paragraph. They refer to specific properties and their corresponding values of the device or system being discussed. I have removed any entities that do not clearly refer to material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 |
| V OC of 0.79 V |
| FF of 45% |
| PCE of 4.12% |

The table lists the "Property Value" entities from the original paragraph, presented in a markdown table format with one column named "Property Value". The values are presented precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
